events.title: Self-efficacy - beliefs about oneâ€™s ability to perform and achieve a goal
events.description: This is apparently the most important topic for our cohort. The cohort discusses self-efficacy more than a comparable finance discussion forum (99% confidence level).

events.title: Self control and strategic thinking - this topic ranks second behind self-efficacy
events.description: Our cohort frequently reflect about their behaviour, and strategies to control their emotions. Again, we find more discussions of this topic than in a comparable finance discussion forum (95% confidence level).

events.title: Negative emotions are seldom discussed by the cohort
events.description: Most online forums host discussions about depression and anxiety. In comparison with a group of individuals discussing a recent turbulent week in Swiss banking, negative affect is unusually underrepresented in their discussions

events.title: Exploratory analysis of time commitments and the deferred gratification of continuing education
events.description: Time is discussed when students discuss their study plans. Phrases like - a long time - and - take me a long time - may be informative.
